rename.from: stubgen: use `X | Y` / `X | None` instead of `Union[X, Y]` / `Optional[X]`
rename.to: stubgen: use `X | Y` / `X | None` instead of `Union[X, Y]` / `Union[X, None]`

body: Anyway, it is weird that `from typing import Union` is not inserted by stubgen...

@eggplants if stubgen doesn't import Union when it should, please open a separate issue with a reproducer. We should definitely fix that, and I suspect it'll be easy.

I'm a little more uncertain about this issue, since mypy still has a few bugs where it doesn't accept `|`, and it would be bad if stubgen generated stubs that mypy itself rejects.

issue.title: stubgen: import `Union` if generated stub code includes
issue.body:
**Feature**

I would like to insert `from typing import Union` when generated stub code by stubgen includes `Union`.

**Pitch**

ref: #12920

Now:

```shellsession
# Python 3.10.4, mypy 0.960
$ cat test.py
import random


def a() -> int | str:
    if random.random() > 0.5:
        return 1
    else:
        return "hey!"

def b() -> str | None:
    if random.random() > 0.5:
        return "hey!"

$ stubgen test.py
Processed 1 modules
Generated out/test.pyi

$ cat out/test.pyi
def a() -> Union[int, str]: ...
def b() -> Union[str, None]: ...
```

Expect:

```python
from typing import Union

def a() -> Union[int, str]: ...
def b() -> Union[str, None]: ...
```

body:
> I'm a little more uncertain about this issue, since mypy still has a few bugs where it doesn't accept `|`, and it would be bad if stubgen generated stubs that mypy itself rejects.

We could safely teach stubgen to use PEP 604 in non-runtime contexts. But that might be more complicated than it's worth; it might be better to wait until mypy has full PEP-604 support.

issue.title: Upgrade stub files generated by stubgen

repository.name: pyupgrade
repository.description: A tool (and pre-commit hook) to automatically upgrade syntax for newer versions of the language.

issue.body:
I would like to upgrade annotations of stub files generated by `stubgen`.

Maybe related: https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/12920

issue.title: [stubgen] Preserve PEP 604 Unions in generated pyi files
issue.body:
When a PEP 604 Union exists in the runtime, stubgen was generating a `Union[...]` syntax without importing `Union` from `typing`. With this change, stubgen preserves the ` | `-unions in the output.

Fixes #12929
Closes #13428
Ref #12920
